LanguageData.ZP_PrantJapaneseRadish.label: Daikon
LanguageData.ZP_PrantJapaneseRadish.description: This Japanese radish is defined by its white, carrot-like shape, big green leaves, and short growing period. Daikon are somewhat large, which makes storing them far more difficult than rice or wheat.
LanguageData.ZP_PrantTaro.label: Taro
LanguageData.ZP_PrantTaro.description: This potato-like plant has a long growing period and high yield. On the Rim, it is often used as a substitute for Konnyaku.
LanguageData.ZP_PrantCarrot.label: Carrot
LanguageData.ZP_PrantCarrot.description: ニンジン。寒さに強い作物。カレーライスの具材にぴったり。
LanguageData.ZP_PrantTreeBamboo.label: Bamboo
LanguageData.ZP_PrantTreeBamboo.description: タケノコがとれる。食用に特化しているため竹はとれない。
LanguageData.ZP_PrantSweetPotato.label: Sweet potato[ZP]
LanguageData.ZP_PrantSweetPotato.description: サツマイモ。江戸時代の食糧危機の救世主。痩せた土地でも育つので重宝する。
